Post._content:
## 

javascript > style > layout > paint > composite



### 

#### Worker

 worker?

- Forced synchrounous layout is a possible performance bottleneck.

  ```javascript
  for(var p = 0; p < paragraphs.length; p++) {
    var blockWidth = greenBlock.offsetWidth; 
    paragraphs[p].style.width = blockWidth + 'px'; //  layout
  }
  ```

-  synchrounous layout

  read layout properties then batch style changes.  layout property 

-  layout  js function

  `clientHeight..., focus(), getBoundingClientRect(), innerText, offsetHeight..., scrollByLInes(), scrollByPages(), scrollHeight, scrollIntoView(), scrollIntroViewIfNeeded(), scrollLeft, scrollTop, scrollWidth`

- trigger paint is very expensive.

-  layout  idle loading 

- update layer tree, composite layer => `will-change transform: translateZ(0)`

- performant matters



[street view API](http://maps.googleapis.com/maps/api/streetview?size=600x300&location=)

  ```ruby
  module Heaven
    # Top-level module for providers.
    module Provider
      # The capistrano provider.
      class Capistrano < DefaultProvider
   	.....
        def execute
          return execute_and_log(["/usr/bin/true"]) if Rails.env.test?

          unless File.exist?(checkout_directory)
            log "Cloning #{repository_url} into #{checkout_directory}"
            execute_and_log(["git", "clone", clone_url, checkout_directory])
          end

          Dir.chdir(checkout_directory) do
            log "Fetching the latest code"
            execute_and_log(%w{git fetch})
            execute_and_log(["git", "reset", "--hard", sha])
            deploy_command = [cap_path, environment, " cap "]
            log "Executing capistrano: #{deploy_command.join(" ")}"
            execute_and_log(deploy_command)
          end
        end
      end
    end
  end
  ```

  ```ruby
  module Heaven
    # Top-level module for providers.
    module Provider
      # The capistrano provider.
      class Capistrano < DefaultProvider
   	.....
        def execute
          return execute_and_log(["/usr/bin/true"]) if Rails.env.test?

          unless File.exist?(checkout_directory)
            log "Cloning #{repository_url} into #{checkout_directory}"
            execute_and_log(["git", "clone", clone_url, checkout_directory])
          end

          Dir.chdir(checkout_directory) do
            log "Fetching the latest code"
            execute_and_log(%w{git fetch})
            execute_and_log(["git", "reset", "--hard", sha])
            deploy_command = [cap_path, environment, " cap "]
            log "Executing capistrano: #{deploy_command.join(" ")}"
            execute_and_log(deploy_command)
          end
        end
      end
    end
  end
  ```

Post.title: ramda  API
Post._content:
### 

ramda  lodash  underscore  ramda  **functional programming**  lodash API  ramda  FP  API ramda  curry

 lodash API 

```javascript
_.map([1,2,3], (n) => n * 2); // [2, 4, 6]
```

 ramda 

```javascript
R.map((n) => n * 2, [1,2,3]); // [2, 4, 6]
```



```javascript
const times2 = R.map((n) => n * 2); // return function
times2([1,2,3]); // [2, 4, 6]
```



 FP [](https://www.byvoid.com/zhs/blog/why-functional-programming)

###  functional programming

-  input  output
- 

### Ramda

ramda  API  API  ramda  API  API

#### propEq



```javascript
const obj = {
  name: 'kalan'
}

propEq('name', 'kalan')(obj); // true

// 
const propEq = (name, value) => (obj) => {
  return obj[name] === value;
}
```

#### zipObj

 `object`

```javascript
R.zipObj(['id', 'title'], ['2', 'mytitle']);
/*
{
  id: '2',
  title: 'mytitle'
}
*/
```



#### ifElse

 branch  `ifelse` ramda  API  compose  API

#### compose

 `f(g(h(x)))` `h(x)` 

```javascript
const a = compose(
  toInteger,
  toCurrency('TWD'),
  toUppercase
)("125000")
```



#### useWith



 `useWith`  point free 

```javascript
const currencies = [
  { name: 'TWD', shape: '$' },
  { name: 'USD', shape: '$' },
  { name: 'JPY', shape: '' },
  { name: 'CAD', shape: '$' }
];

// without useWith
const getCurrency = (name, dic) => R.find(
  R.propEq('name', name),
  dic
);

getCurrency('TWD', currencies); // $

// with useWith
const getCurrency = R.useWith(
  R.find,
  [R.propEq('name'), R.identity]
); //  R.propEq R.identity R.find 

getCurrency('TWD', currencies);
```

 `useWith`  `name` `dic` 

![fn1](/Users/kalan/Desktop/fn1.png)

#### converge

 `useWith`  converge 

```javascript
const numbers = [1,2,5,8,10];

const getRange = R.converge(substract, [getFirst, getLast])(numbers); // return 9
```





![fn2](/Users/kalan/Desktop/fn2.png)

#### identity

......

```javascript
const identify = (arg) => arg
```

 chainable `identity` 

#### tap

 debug 

```javascript
tap(console.log)('hello world'); //  hello world  console.log hello world 
```

 `tap`  `compose` 

```javascript
const uploadToMedium = article => API.postArticle(article);
const notifyAdmin    = article => API.notify(article, subscribers);
const log = article => Logger.log(article)
const preprocessArticle = article => article.toLowerCase()

const publishPostFlow = (article) => compose(
  preprocessArticle,
  R.tap(uploadToMedium),
  R.tap(notifyAdmin),
  R.tap(log)
);

publishPostFlow(article);
```

 `return article` 

#### pluck

 value 

```javascript
const data = [
{
  id: '1',
  content: 'content...'
}, {
  id: '2',
  content: 'content...'
},
{
  id: '3',
  content: 'content...'
}];

const getIds = R.pluck('id', data); // return ['1','2','3']
```

#### pick, pickBy, pickAll

 `pick` 

```javascript
const data = {
  "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/example/magazine/issues/1",
  "repository_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/example/magazine",
  "labels_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/example/magazine/issues/1/labels{/name}",
  "comments_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/example/magazine/issues/1/comments",
  "events_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/example/magazine/issues/1/events",
  "html_url": "https://github.com/example/magazine/issues/1",
  "id": 252372781,
  "number": 1,
  "title": "test issue",
}

R.pick(['url', 'repository_url', 'id', 'name'], data); // 

R.pickAll(['url', 'repository_url', 'name'], data) //  undefined

const isURL = (value, key) => key.indexOf('_url') !== -1
R.pickBy(isURL, data); //  _url
```



#### pathOr

 API  JSON  `a && a.b && a.b.c` 

`pathOr`  `undefined` 

```javascript
const article = {
  id: "116208916",
  author: {
    information: {
      birthday: "1994-11-11",
      name: 'kalan',
    },
    subscribers_count: 1239
  },
  content: {
  	title: 'title',
	body: 'body'
  }
}
```

 `pathOr` 

```javascript
const getBirthday = R.pathOr(['author', 'information', 'birthday'], '');
getBirthday(article);
```

#### memoize

 memoize

  id: '3',
  content: 'content...'
}];

#### pick, pickBy, pickAll

 `pick` 

```javascript
const data = {
  "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/example/magazine/issues/1",
  "repository_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/example/magazine",
  "labels_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/example/magazine/issues/1/labels{/name}",
  "comments_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/example/magazine/issues/1/comments",
  "events_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/example/magazine/issues/1/events",
  "html_url": "https://github.com/example/magazine/issues/1",
  "id": 252372781,
  "number": 1,
  "title": "test issue",
}

R.pick(['url', 'repository_url', 'id', 'name'], data); // 

R.pickAll(['url', 'repository_url', 'name'], data) //  undefined

const isURL = (value, key) => key.indexOf('_url') !== -1
R.pickBy(isURL, data); //  _url
```

style guide ## 1. styleguide 2. `ws_job_index` search bar ## Styleguide view helper class code styleguide consistency code document driven ## Helper helper `rails` `ruby` view HTML ```html <%= ui_component("sudo_tags", { :tags => "blabla" }) %> ``` `ui_component` render ```ruby def ui_component url, options = nil render "components/#{url}", :locals => options end ``` `component` `content_tag` ```ruby def button_generator content, options = nil btn_class = "btn " options.merge(:class => btn_class) content_tag :button, content, options end ``` ## layout grid `layout` css attribute selector ```html
